result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad J Grimes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice

Petition and Order for Payment of Court-Appointed Counsel Fees
Final Statement
Cover letter

The action has concluded on this case and the Court-appointed counsel is removed

2:05 PM Defendant Chad J Grimes appeared by video.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Chad J Grimes.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to amend Disorderly Conduct contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01. Motion granted. 
No contest plea entered to the amended count 1. Rights explained. Convicted. 
$100 fine plus costs, total $579 to be paid by 11-08-2022 or 11 days jail for failure to pay.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.
Plea date on September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:30 AM Defendant Chad J Grimes appeared by video.  Attorney Anthony Lambrecht appears via video for Jacalyn Christie Labre for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Chad J Grimes.  Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial. 
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information to be filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  September 16, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-04-22 at 9:30 a.m.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Turner  is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to the standard collection practices of the Manitowoc County Clerk of Court office.
Addendum to Order on Petition for Appointment of Counsel.
